social_interpersonal.question_text: In team meetings, you naturally tend to:

options.option_text: Ensure everyone has a chance to contribute and be heard
Ask clarifying questions to ensure mutual understanding
Summarize key points and action items for the group
Suggest creative solutions when discussions get stuck

social_interpersonal.question_text: Your approach to conflict resolution emphasizes:

options.option_text: Understanding the underlying needs and concerns of all parties
Finding win-win solutions that address everyone's core interests
Creating safe spaces for honest and respectful dialogue
Focusing on future collaboration rather than past grievances
Being specific about behaviors rather than making personal judgments
Balancing constructive criticism with recognition of strengths
Adapting your communication style to the recipient's preferences
Focusing on future improvement rather than past mistakes

social_interpersonal.question_text: Your leadership style is characterized by:

options.option_text: Empowering others and developing their capabilities
Creating shared vision and inspiring commitment to common goals
Adapting your approach based on team member needs and situations
Encouraging innovation and creative problem-solving

social_interpersonal.question_text: When building relationships with new colleagues, you focus on:

options.option_text: Understanding their communication preferences and work styles
Finding common interests and shared experiences
Demonstrating reliability and trustworthiness through consistent actions
Learning about their professional goals and aspirations

social_interpersonal.question_text: Your emotional intelligence is evident when you:

options.option_text: Recognize and respond appropriately to others' emotional states
Manage your own emotions effectively under pressure
Help others process and work through difficult emotions
Create emotionally positive environments for teams

social_interpersonal.question_text: In cross-cultural or diverse settings, you excel at:

options.option_text: Adapting your communication style to cultural norms and expectations
Asking questions to understand different perspectives and backgrounds
Finding common ground while respecting differences
Leveraging diversity to generate more creative solutions
Create structured processes that ensure productive dialogue
Encourage participation from quieter members
Help the group navigate difficult or sensitive topics
Keep discussions focused while allowing for creative exploration

social_interpersonal.question_text: Your approach to mentoring and coaching emphasizes:

options.option_text: Asking powerful questions that help others discover their own insights
Providing emotional support and encouragement during challenges
Sharing relevant experiences and lessons learned
Helping others develop creative problem-solving capabilities

social_interpersonal.question_text: In customer or client relationships, you focus on:

options.option_text: Understanding their underlying business needs and constraints
Building long-term partnerships based on mutual trust
Communicating complex information in accessible ways
Collaborating to develop innovative solutions to their challenges
Building genuine relationships rather than transactional connections
Finding ways to help others achieve their goals
Staying connected through regular, meaningful communication
Connecting people who could benefit from knowing each other

social_interpersonal.question_text: When presenting to audiences, you excel at:

options.option_text: Reading the room and adjusting your message based on audience reactions
Using storytelling to make your points memorable and engaging
Creating interactive experiences that involve the audience
Translating complex concepts into relatable examples

social_interpersonal.question_text: Your strength in empathy allows you to:

options.option_text: Understand and validate others' perspectives, even when you disagree
Anticipate how decisions will impact different stakeholders
Provide emotional support during difficult times
Design solutions that address human needs and emotions

social_interpersonal.question_text: In team building activities, you focus on:

options.option_text: Creating opportunities for team members to understand each other better
Establishing clear communication norms and expectations
Building trust through shared experiences and vulnerability
Encouraging collaboration through creative problem-solving challenges

social_interpersonal.question_text: Your approach to change management emphasizes:

options.option_text: Addressing people's emotional responses to change
Communicating the rationale and benefits clearly and repeatedly
Involving stakeholders in designing the change process
Creating support systems and celebrating progress along the way

social_interpersonal.question_text: When working with difficult personalities, you:

options.option_text: Look for the underlying needs or concerns driving their behavior
Adapt your communication style to what works best with them
Set clear boundaries while remaining respectful and professional
Find creative ways to redirect their energy toward positive outcomes

social_interpersonal.question_text: Your communication strength is evident when you:

options.option_text: Listen actively and ask questions that deepen understanding
Synthesize complex information into clear, actionable messages
Tailor your message to your audience's knowledge level and interests
Create compelling narratives that inspire action

social_interpersonal.question_text: Your interpersonal impact is greatest when you:

options.option_text: Help others develop their potential and achieve their goals
Build bridges between people with different perspectives
Create inclusive environments where everyone feels valued
Inspire teams to achieve more than they thought possible
